sense.def:
To keep someone or something in a particular state or place
pomeni povzročiti, da nekdo ali nekaj ostane v določenem položaju ali kraju.

seg.quote: They had been kept awake by nightingales.
She kept her arm around her husband as she spoke.
He bought a guard dog to keep out intruders.
Sorry to keep you waiting.

sense.def:
To keep in a particular state or place
pomeni ostati v nekem položaju ali kraju.

seg.quote: They've got to hunt for food to keep alive.
Keep in touch.
They kept away from the forest.

sense.def:
Kadar na oznaki piše
Keep Out
, je to opozorilo, da nekam ne smemo iti.

To keep doing something
ali
to keep on doing something
pomeni nekaj večkrat ali vztrajno delati, ne da bi se ustavili.

seg.quote: I keep making the same mistake.
The men just kept walking.
They kept on walking for a while in silence.
I kept on getting up and staring out of the window.

sense.def:
To keep something
pomeni še naprej nekaj imeti.

seg.quote: Why didn't Daddy let me keep the ten dollars?
She would not be able to keep her job.

sense.def:
To keep something in a particular place
pomeni, da nekaj sodi na določen kraj.

seg.quote: ...the shelf where the butter and cheese were kept.
Keep a spare key in your bag.

sense.def:
Keep
uporabljamo z nekaterimi samostalniki in tako povemo, da nekdo vztraja pri neki dejavnosti. Na primer:
to keep a grip on something
pomeni nekaj kar naprej držati ali obvladovati.

seg.quote: They would keep a look-out for him.

sense.def:
To keep someone or something from doing something
pomeni nekomu ali nečemu preprečiti določeno dejanje.

seg.quote: She had to hold the boy tight, to keep him from falling.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
keeps someone
, povzroči, da nekdo nekam pride pozneje, kot je bilo pričakovano.

seg.quote: Am I keeping you from your party?
What kept you?

sense.def:
To keep something
pomeni izpolniti nekaj, kar smo obljubili, na primer obljubo ali zmenek.

seg.quote: Hearst kept his word.

sense.def:
To keep something from someone
pomeni nekomu ne povedati o nečem.

seg.quote: Why did you keep it from me?

sense.def:
To keep a record of a series of events
pomeni zapisati si vrsto dogodkov.

seg.quote: We keep a record of the noise levels.

sense.def:
To keep animals
pomeni imeti živali v lasti in skrbeti zanje.

seg.quote: My dad kept chickens.

sense.def:
One's keep
je cena hrane in drugih stvari, ki jih potrebujemo vsak dan.

seg.quote: The grant includes £19 for your keep during the vacation.

sense.def:
Kadar je ena stvar
in keeping with another thing
, je skupaj z drugo stvarjo videti prava ali primerna.

seg.quote: Her white socks and brown shoes were not quite in keeping with her beautiful satin evening dress.

sense.def:
To keep a number or amount down
pomeni ne dovoliti, da bi se neka količina ali število povečala.

seg.quote: The French are very concerned to keep costs down.

sense.def:
To keep something off
pomeni preprečiti, da bi nas nekaj doseglo in nam škodovalo.

seg.quote: They built a bamboo shelter to keep the rain off.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
keeps on about something
, o tistem govori veliko in tako, da s tem nekoga jezi.

seg.quote: She kept on about the car.

sense.def:
To keep to a rule, plan, or agreement
pomeni storiti tako, kot zahteva pravilo, načrt ali sporazum.

seg.quote: We must keep to the deadlines.

sense.def:
To keep something to a particular amount
pomeni nekaj omejiti na določeno količino.

seg.quote: Keep it to a minimum.

sense.def:
Kadar neka oseba ali stvar
keeps up with another
, se prva stvar premika, napreduje ali povečuje ravno tako hitro kot druga.

seg.quote: I started to run, so that she had to hurry to keep up with me.
Pensions were increased to keep up with the rise in prices.

sense.def:
To keep up with what is happening
pomeni poskrbeti, da vemo, kaj se dogaja.

seg.quote: Even friends have trouble keeping up with each other's whereabouts.
